pullRequest.body:
Add `mgf_ident_distrib`, `mgf_sum_iid`.
These are some of the supporting lemmas we have proved on our way to formalizing the central limit theorem.

Co-authored-by: Siyuan Ge <jamesgsy@uw.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [35dfc7519e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19886/commits/35dfc7519e638f571c56c7fd745f93aef145c812)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Moments | 1943 | 1947 | +4 (+0.21%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Moments`|4|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ mgf_congr_of_identDistrib`
`+ mgf_sum_of_identDistrib`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@sgouezel , I just moved the gaussian mgf lemma in another PR: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19896.

I addressed all your comments.
@sgouezel , friendly ping. Thank you for your attention!
Thanks, @YaelDillies. I applied your suggestions.
I didn't ask that you should remove the result for the Gaussian, only that you move it to the file about the Gaussian. I think it's definitely a good result to have!
Thank you for the PR! Should be easy to get in
Thank you for implementing the changes! Here are a few more suggestions
Instead of having `X` and `Y` defined on the same space, could you have `X` defined on Omega and `Y` defined on Omega'?
Thank you, I used your suggestion.

We have quite rigid indentation rules in mathlib (it may look cumbersome at first, but in the long run it helps to have a coherent library). So, except for the first one, the lines of the statement should be indented by 4 spaces, while the lines of proofs should be indented by 2 spaces (plus additional indentation for subgoals). Here, you do the opposite :-)

Indentation is also not mathlib-like here. Let me show you how it should be:
```suggestion
theorem mgf_sum_iid
    {X : ι → Ω → ℝ}
    (h_meas : ∀ (i : ι), Measurable (X i))
    (h_indep : ProbabilityTheory.iIndepFun (fun _ => inferInstance) X μ)
    (hident : ∀ (i j : ι), ProbabilityTheory.IdentDistrib (X i) (X j) μ μ)
    (s : Finset ι) (j : ι) : 
    ∀ t : ℝ, mgf (∑ i ∈ s, X i) μ t = (mgf (X j) μ (t)) ^ s.card := by
  intro t
  rw [iIndepFun.mgf_sum h_indep h_meas]
  exact Finset.prod_eq_pow_card (fun i si => mgf_ident_distrib (X i) (X j) (hident i j))
```
(possibly regrouping some variables on common lines)

Can you also fix the indentation of this one? Also, I'd move it to the files on gaussians, to avoid putting more imports in the current file (which should remain one of the basic files in probability). Maybe also give the statement for non-centered non-normalized gaussians?
I am confused why this is flagged as a new change given https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19798...
If you merge master into the branch of this PR it should go away.
Thank you, it worked.

```suggestion
    (X : Ω → ℝ) {Ω' : Type*} {m' : MeasurableSpace Ω'} {μ' : Measure Ω'} (X' : Ω' → ℝ)
```
This is more robust.

You're telling Lean to rewrite things that it already knows are the same (as you prove them by `rfl`). This means that this is not really necessary, and that you can just skip all these steps, to get:
```suggestion
  apply IdentDistrib.integral_eq
  apply IdentDistrib.comp hident (Measurable.exp (measurable_const_mul t))
```
could you assume `hident` only for `i, j` in `s`?
Yes, done.

```suggestion
    (s : Finset ι) (j : ι) (t : ℝ) : 
    mgf (∑ i ∈ s, X i) μ t = (mgf (X j) μ t) ^ s.card := by
```
Put `t` left of the colon, in this way you don't need to `intro` it in the proof below.

```suggestion
    mgf X μ t = mgf X' μ' t := hident.comp (measurable_const_mul t).exp |>.integral_eq
```

```suggestion
theorem mgf_congr_identDistrib
```

```suggestion
theorem mgf_sum_of_identDistrib
```

```suggestion
  exact Finset.prod_eq_pow_card fun i si => mgf_ident_distrib (X i) (X j) (hident ⟨i,si⟩ j) t
```

```suggestion
theorem mgf_congr_of_identDistrib
```

You shouldn't need this assumption at all since `hident` implies `AEMeasurable (X i) μ`
```suggestion
```

But `hident` does not imply `Measurable (X i) μ`, right? And we need it for `mgf_sum`. 
A later refactor might weaken the measurability assumption of `mgf_sum` to `AEMeasurable` or `AEStronglyMeasurable` instead of `Measurable`. But for now, I need `Measurable (X i) μ`.

Too many brackets and also please use the notation for `Finset.card`
```suggestion
    (t : ℝ) : mgf (∑ i ∈ s, X i) μ t = mgf (X j) μ t ^ #s := by
```
(you might need `open scoped Finset`)

```suggestion
    (h_indep : iIndepFun (fun _ => inferInstance) X μ)
```

It's better to have `j : ι` + `j ∈ s` rather than ` j : s`
```suggestion
    {s : Finset ι} {j : ι} (hj : j ∈ s)
```
Also I think `hj` should be the last proof obligation in this statement, namely it should come just before `(t : ℝ)`

```suggestion
    (hident : ∀ i ∈ s, ∀ j ∈ s, IdentDistrib (X i) (X j) μ μ)
```

Please keep imports alphabetical
```suggestion
import Mathlib.Probability.IdentDistrib
import Mathlib.Probability.Variance
```

```suggestion
  rw [h_indep.mgf_sum h_meas]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability/Moments): add lemmas about moment generating functions
